results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new Holden car, from an artist’s conception, through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model Holden car.

results.title: Before it's too late
results.brief_description: A road safety film emphasizing the importance of using seat belts in vehicles and how they do save lives. Collision tests conducted at the University of California show what can happen in an accident. The uncontrolled movements can damage the body in numerous ways, ejection being the most fatal. Thousands of lives could have been saved if people used their seat belts rather than sat on them. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: A Beethoven sonata
results.brief_description: One of Beethoven’s earliest works is finely played and recorded in this film. Dennis Brain (horn) and Dennis Matthews (piano) give a performance of the Sonata in F for horn and piano, Opus 17. Contrasts the horn as it was in Beethoven’s time with the improved and more complicated instrument of to-day. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven and his music
results.brief_description: The music of Beethoven reflects the great social upheaval of the late eighteenth century, the composer’s own unusual strength and genius and the transition from the classic formality of Haydn and Mozart to more romantic expression. The film develops the relationships between Beethoven’s environment and his personal response to it in terms of his music. Excerpts from the following are included in the film. First and Fourth Movement of the Symphony No. 5; The First Movement of the Violin Sonata, Opus 12 no. 2; the First Movement of the Archduke Trio, Opus 97; the First Movement of the Symphony No. 3 “Eroica”; the Piano Sonata No.14, Opus 27, No. 2 “Moonlight”; and the First Movement of the Symphony no. 6 “Pastoral”; the First Movement of the Piano Concerto No. 5 “Emperor”. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven....and all that jazz
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which a jazz orchestra is seen playing against background music of a Beethoven’s Piano Sonato No. 29. No other credits available.

results.title: Beef, grass and dairy calves
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to farmers the new techniques of calf rearing which can be successfully incorporated into existing farming systems. It underlines the higher productivity and therefore greater profitability which results from the new methods when and if they are used.

results.title: Beech foresters
results.brief_description: This film reviews the extent and nature of beech forests in New Zealand and describes schemes undertaken for improvement. Draws attention to the work of the New Zealand Forest Service in carrying out aerial and ground surveys and compiling information, resulting in such schemes as the erection of deer-proof fences, selection of seed trees and the establishment of even age forests. Describes the uses to which timber is put. No other credits available.
